title: Solar Core 5.0
description: Next-generation blockchain core upgrade, enhancing security and scalability.

tasks.title: Byzantine Fault Tolerance (BFT) Consensus
tasks.details: Solar Core 5.0 introduces a Byzantine Fault Tolerance (BFT) consensus model, providing a robust solution for network consensus, even in the presence of faulty or malicious activities. By combining BFT with aggregated Boneh-Lynn-Schacham (BLS) signatures, we ensure immediate block finality and a fork-resistant network. This also enhances security by allowing block producers to run multiple nodes simultaneously, selecting only active block producers for optimal uptime and reliability.

tasks.title: Solar Virtual Machine (SVM)
tasks.details:
The Solar Virtual Machine (SVM) is being developed to integrate with Solar Core, inspired by the Ethereum Virtual Machine. It will support Ethereum-compatible tools such as MetaMask and Solidity.



Development Roadmap:

1. Defining requirements and feasibility studies (Done)

2. Developing a proof of concept (Done)

3. Refining the proof of concept into a product (In Progress)

4. Integrating SVM into Solar Core

5. Conducting security and correctness testing

6. Public Testnet release

tasks.title: Permissioned Keys
tasks.details: Introducing permissioned keys for enhanced security, allowing users to enable specific wallet functions without using their master mnemonic. Users can register multiple permissioned keys with specific rights, such as sending a set amount of SXP or updating a wallet vote, while the master mnemonic retains full control.

tasks.title: Username Registration
tasks.details: Solar Core 5.0 introduces username registration, allowing users to create human-readable blockchain addresses without needing to be block producers. This enables easy transactions, additional metadata storage (avatars, bios), and potential cross-chain support.

tasks.title: Node Management Enhancements
tasks.details:
Solar Core 5.0 enhances node operations by:

- Improving security by switching from PostgreSQL to SQLite3

- Streamlining node management interface

- Disabling Public API by default for better security

- Restricting plugins to relay nodes (non-block producers)

tasks.title: Solarscan - Blockchain Explorer
tasks.details: A cutting-edge block explorer that tracks transactions, network health, and the latest blocks in real time. Solarscan continuously evolves with Solar Core 5.0, providing personalised wallet views for mainnet and testnet.

tasks.title: FoxBox (Gaming Console)
tasks.details:
Developing a Web3-native gaming console supporting the entire Tymt library.

- Fully compatible with controllers and VR.

- Mobile login via the Tymt mobile app to prevent exposing private keys on-screen.

- Encourages Web3 developers to build 'couch-friendly' blockchain games, addressing a market gap.

tasks.title: Moon.Store Marketplace
tasks.details:
Moon.Store will be rebranded as Tymt Marketplace.

- Will serve as both a digital and physical marketplace.

- Supports trading in-game assets and NFTs.

- Allows developers to sell merchandise directly to players.

- Users can create, mint, and list NFTs.

tasks.title: Developer Console
tasks.details:
A central hub for developers, similar to Google Play Console.

- Native game listing will require a small fee.

- Web3 game developers can self-onboard by submitting a GitHub pull request.

- Automated checks for security, malware, and content quality.

tasks.title: Advertising System

tasks.title: In-App Exchange
